results.title: Heart sweet heart
results.creator_credit: B Stepantsev, Soiuzmultfilm and World Health Organisation
results.brief_description: Good heartkeeping makes life better, is the message of this animated cartoon film. Mr Anybody lives in a four-roomed apartment, in the four chambers of his own heart. He loves eating and smoking and hates to move around, but smoke fills his arteries and fat invades his heart. His home starts crumbling, the walls are cracking, the heart is sick. Help arrives in the form of a lady doctor who cleans up the house, throwing out the cigarettes and bringing in fresh air.
results.creator_credit_for_label: B Stepantsev, Soiuzmultfilm and World Health Organisation

results.title: The Heart of the matter
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts for Life”.
Examines the demands placed upon the heart and lungs, demonstrated by treadmill experiments in the laboratory. Shows that causes of heart diseases are aggravated by over-eating and lack of exercise and that lung damage can be caused by smoking and air pollution.

results.title: The Heart of a nation
results.brief_description: A film record of the 1953 Welsh Eisteddford featuring the ceremonial and some of the typical international song and dance events that take place at this famous annual festival. In this instance the festival was held at Aberystwyth on the shores of Cardigan Bay.

results.title: Heart of a city
results.creator_credit: Ralph W Peterson, Brian Chirlian, Ajax Films and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Documentary about Queensland’s capital city, Brisbane: the people, cultural events, city and environs. The role of government departments in the city including local government, council planners and Brisbane City Council. Cinematographer/Director of Photography: Keith Loone.

results.title: The Heart is highland
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Some aspects of the life of the people of the Scottish Highlands are shown, linking present developments in industry, agriculture and transport with the country’s dramatic past - well symbolised by the interior of Glamis Castle.

results.title: The Heart: how it works
results.brief_description: Shows the structure of the heart, and how it serves as a pump for the circulation of blood. Explains methods for testing and examining, showing the stethoscope, and analyses the sound cycles by which this instrument works. Concludes with some startling facts about the ordinary workload of the heart.

results.title: Heart, head and hand: Peter Rushforth, potter
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir and Crafts Council of Australia
results.brief_description: Scenes from the life and work of potter Peter Rushforth. This film shows how Rushforth’s philosophy and strong belief in craft as a way of life has reached all those with whom he has been in contact, and the respect and admiration in which he is held both personally and professionally by students, colleagues and friends. Photography by John Seale and music by the Renaissance Players.

results.title: Life and health: the heart - counter attack
results.creator_credit: Norman Siegel and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: The major causes of heart disease weaken the heart to make a person vulnerable. Steps can be taken by the individual and society to decrease or eliminate these causes. Smoking, overweight and a lack of physical fitness are highlighted as prime causes of heart disease. Tension and stress and methods of overcoming their effect on the heart re dealt with.

results.title: The Heart and circulatory system
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Media-Four Productions
results.brief_description: Establishes the function of the circulatory system in transporting oxygen and the history of ideas about this. Harvey’s early experiments are shown and also microphotography of the heart. Developments in current heart research are shown.

results.title: Heard and not seen
results.creator_credit: A. Henley and Masters and Boys of Holloway School
results.brief_description: A boy sent out of art class for misbehaviour mixes a drink in the chemistry laboratory which makes him invisible. A series of amusing incidents ensue. Finally the effects wear off and he is caught in the headmaster’s office.
